Context:

Code: B305
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Online
Duration: 5 semesters (up to 8 years allowed for completion)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Centre: Business
School: Management
Location: St. James Campus
Delivery: Semester 4: Online, Winter 2024: Semester 4, 5, 6: Online
Program Description: A tri-college collaboration between Algonquin College, George Brown College and Mohawk College. Prepares students with skills in business administration, management, accounting, project management, leadership, communication and applied research competencies. Enables students to grow their own skilled trades business or take on greater responsibilities in their current work environment and/or pursue management careers in medium to large organizations.

Context:
The Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) is a degree-completion program that provides advanced standing for those with apprenticeship/journeyperson training or trade-related diploma programs. It focuses on business administration, managerial, accounting, project management, leadership, communication and applied research competencies.

The program's delivery format is fully online, allowing students to continue working while taking the program. Graduates possess a unique blend of practical knowledge and business theory. Employment opportunities exist in starting one's own business, managing trades-related businesses, or improving existing businesses in various sectors.

The program is offered by three colleges: Mohawk, Algonquin, and George Brown. Students are required to complete 420 hours (equivalent to 14 weeks) of a paid co-op experience as part of the degree program.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Business Trades) Program B305 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text is about a college program offering a co-op experience for students in trades-related fields. Students can gain business experience through this opportunity in one or multiple blocks, often in trades-related organizations. Graduates of this program may find careers as business managers, project managers, quality control managers, maintenance and trades managers, service-related managers, among others.

Required courses for the program include Microeconomics (ECO 1101), Macroeconomics (ECO 2101), Statistics (QUA 2002), Financial Accounting (BACC 1012), Principles of Business Management and Research Part 2 (BBUS 2105), Computer Business Applications (BCMP 2017), Risk Management (MGMT 2013), Professional Practice (XBUS 3500), Marketing (XMKT 3501), Canadian Business Law (BLAW 2015), Managerial Accounting (BACC 2013), Project Management (MGT 4602), Human Resource Management (BFSM 4111), Work Integrated Learning (CO-OP) (BCOP3002), Operations Management (BBUS 4011), Managing Small and Medium Enterprises (MGT 2015), Management Information Systems (MGT 2014), Finance (BACC 3014), Trades Marketing (XMKT 4700), Capstone Applied Research Project I (XCRE 4701), Strategic Thinking and Management (XMGT 4800), International Business (BBUS 4107), Negotiation Strategies (MGT 2012), and two Liberal Studies Electives.

The program learning outcomes are for the graduate to support business objectives by leveraging the interdependencies of functional business units including human resources, marketing, finance and accounting; conduct research to support strategic and operational decisions; and deploy strategic planning techniques to ensure competitive advantage in the trades industry.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Business Trades) Program B305 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: The text provides information about a flexible degree program offered at George Brown College in the trades industry. The program covers various aspects of managing trade businesses, including strategic planning, project management, risk management, marketing, legal compliance, technology use, financial analysis, and community engagement. tuition for the program is not specified in the text, but it's mentioned that the cost varies based on the courses taken and that additional costs such as books and supplies are not included. OSAP eligibility for the program is pending review by the Ministry. The admission requirements include a post-secondary transcript and departmental review. Eligible professions include Instrumentation and Control Technician, Landscape Horticulturist, Machinist, Steamfitter/Pipe Fitter, Tool and Die Maker, Aerospace/Aviation, Fire Suppression, Military, and Sheet Metal Worker. Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions. The program has been granted a consent by the Ministry to run for seven years starting from December 21, 2020. To contact the department for more information, use the email address business@georgebrown.ca.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) (Honours) (Pathway Business Trades) Program B305 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: To apply for the renewal of the consent for the program, George Brown College will submit an application 12 months prior to the expiration of the consent. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. Information sessions are held regularly on campus. For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, deadlines, or the admissions process, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section. For international student inquiries, contact an international recruitment representative by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry through the International Contact Us page. For financial aid inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section. To make an appointment with an Entry Advisor for advice on program options, review the frequently asked questions first. The Centre for Business can be contacted by email at business@georgebrown.ca or phone (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160. For inquiries related to the Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Trades Management) program, contact Joyce Manu, Program Co-ordinator, at jmanu@georgebrown.ca. The Centre for Business can be followed on Instagram and LinkedIn. This program is offered out of the School of Management and classes usually take place at the campus.

Context: The program is offered through George Brown College's School of Management. Classes primarily take place at the St. James Campus, specifically at 200 King St. E. and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, ON, Canada. Campus tours are available for registration, and virtual tours are also offered online. Interested individuals can sign up to receive tailored resources for their application process and learn more about the programs and college life by providing their first name, last name, email address, domestic or international status, and country.
